meanings.definition: A large, shapeless mass or lump.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally dropped globs of paint on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The chef scooped up globs of dough to make cookies.
meanings.sent3: The child's attempt at sculpting turned into a globsy mess.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered into dark globs above the city.
meanings.sent5: The monster in the movie was covered in slimy globs of goo.

meanings.definition: A quantity of a thick, sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: The tree was covered in sticky globs of sap.
meanings.sent2: She spread globs of honey on her toast.
meanings.sent3: The prankster left globs of glue on the doorknob.
meanings.sent4: The spilled syrup formed shiny globs on the table.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands were covered in colorful globs of paint.

meanings.definition: To form into globs or lumps.
meanings.sent1: She globs the clay together to create a sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The ingredients globs together to form a thick batter.
meanings.sent3: He globs the snow into a snowball and throws it playfully.
meanings.sent4: The tears globs on her cheeks as she cried.
meanings.sent5: The artist globs the paint onto the canvas with a palette knife.
